info.name: üß™ The Buy Shipping Challenge
info.description: ## üß¶ Ship Happens Welcome, brave SP-API developer! Today, **Chris Khoury** placed a **priority order** from _Debugville_, and Harsh needs to ship it **ASAP**. Only the **fastest shipping rate** will do. But there‚Äôs a problem‚Ä¶ His **Buy Shipping Postman flow is broken** üíÄ Harsh needs **your debugging magic** to fix it. --- ### üõ†Ô∏è Your Mission > **Pre Notes:** No need for credentials as we provided you with mock creds in the collection Your goal is to **fix the broken requests** and get a **label** successfully generated using **Buy Shipping**. The flow is split into 3 steps: --- ### üîî Step 0: Notification payload ``` json { "NotificationVersion" : "1.0", "NotificationType" : "ORDER_CHANGE", "PayloadVersion" : "1.0", "EventTime" : "2023-10-03T01:35:06.382Z", "Payload" : { "OrderChangeNotification" : { "NotificationLevel" : "OrderLevel", "AmazonOrderId" : "111-1111111-1111111", "OrderChangeType" : "OrderStatusChange", "Summary" : { "OrderStatus" : "Unshipped", "FulfillmentType" : "MFN", "OrderType" : "StandardOrder", "OrderPrograms" : [ ], "ShippingPrograms" : [ ], } } } } ``` ### üè† Step 1: Get the Order - Get the `AmazonOrderId` from the Notification Payload above and plug it in Step1 get Order params Tab - Use the `getOrder` request to fetch the order details. - Make note of: - `ShipTo` address attributes (you'll need these next). --- ### üîç Step 2.1: Fix Get Rates Body - Fix the `getRates` request body: - Go to the **Body Tab** to edit the request body - Replace the placeholder `orderId` with the actual `AmazonOrderId` from Step 1 - Use the correct `ShipTo` address from the order‚Äôs fulfillment data - Note that they are marked with a `// TODO` ### üîç Step 2.2: Call Get Rates - Send the request to retrieve available shipping rates. > **üí° üö® In the response, you can visualize the data in a table format if you click on ü™Ñ Visualize. üí° üö®** - Identify the **fastest** rate ‚Äî (the one with the **earliest** **delivery promise** **date**) - Copy the `rateId` from that fastest option ‚Äî you‚Äôll need it for the next step. --- ### üì¶ Step 3.1: Fix Purchase Shipment Body - Go to the **Body Tab** to edit the request body - Plug the correct `rateId` into the `purchaseShipment` request - Note that it is marked with a `// TODO` ### üì¶ Step 3.2: Purchase the Shipment - Send the request and get a successful response with the label! - The label is returned in the format of a github link under `packageDocument.labelFile` --- #### üö®üó£Ô∏èüéâ The label in the final response contains a **password**! #### üì¶üîê Spot it, grab it, and send it to [sp-api-harsh-challenge@amazon.com](https://mailto:sp-api-harsh-challenge@amazon.com) to complete the challenge! --- ### üï∫ Celebrate If everything worked, Harsh got his label and you undestood the BuyShipping Flow. You are one step close to getting the title of **Fulfillment Wizard**. ü™Ñ

item.name: üí® Bonus Rounds

header.description: (Required) Amazon shipping request token
Amazon shipping business to assume for this request. The default is AmazonShipping_UK.

query.description: (Required) A carrier-generated tracking identifier originally returned by the purchaseShipment operation.
(Required) A carrier identifier originally returned by the getRates operation for the selected rate.

**Usage Plan:**

| ---- | ---- |

Selling partners whose business demands require higher throughput may see higher rate and burst values then those shown here. For more information, see [Usage Plans and Rate Limits in the Selling Partner API](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/usage-plans-and-rate-limits-in-the-sp-api).

item.description:
### üîÅ Bonus Round (Optional)

Finished early? Flex your skills with these bonus operations:

#### üì° Track the Shipment

- Use the `getTracking` request to retrieve live tracking info.
    
- You'll need:
    
    - `trackingId` (from the Step 3 `purchaseShipment` response)
        
    - `carrierId` (also from the Step 3 response)
        

#### ‚ùå Cancel the Shipment

- Use the `cancelShipment` request to void a shipment.
    
- You'll need:
    
    - `shipmentId` (returned in the Step 3 `purchaseShipment` response)

variable.description: (Required) An Amazon-defined order identifier, in 3-7-7 format.

header.description: (Required) Amazon shipping request token
(Required) Amazon shipping business to assume for this request. The default is AmazonShipping_UK.

request.description:
The first thing Harsh needs is a list of available shipping options. He knows where he‚Äôs shipping from (SoloSock HQ) and to (Chris in Debugville), so we‚Äôll use that information to call the getRates endpoint.

This step is like going to the post office and asking, ‚ÄúHey, how what options and how much will it cost to ship this package, and how fast can you get it there?‚Äù

Use the code below to structure the request:

Returns the available shipping service offerings.

**Usage Plan:**

| Default Quota | Unit |
| --- | --- |
| 5 | Requests Per Second |

The `x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit` response header returns the usage plan rate limits that were applied to the requested operation, when available. The table above indicates the default rate and burst values for this operation. Selling partners whose business demands require higher throughput may see higher rate and burst values then those shown here. For more information, see [Usage Plans and Rate Limits in the Selling Partner API](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/usage-plans-and-rate-limits-in-the-sp-api).

response.name: get Rates

header.description: (Required) Amazon shipping request token
(Required) Amazon shipping business to assume for this request. The default is AmazonShipping_UK.
(Required) Amazon shipping request token
(Required) Amazon shipping business to assume for this request. The default is AmazonShipping_UK.

request.description:
Purchases a shipping service and returns purchase related details and documents.

Note: You must complete the purchase within **10 minutes** of rate creation by the shipping service provider. If you make the request after the 10 minutes have expired, you will receive an error response with the error code equal to "TOKEN_EXPIRED". If you receive this error response, you must get the rates for the shipment again.

**Usage Plan:**

| Default Quota | Unit |
| ---- | ---- |
| 5 | Requests Per Second |

The `x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit` response header returns the usage plan rate limits that were applied to the requested operation, when available. The table above indicates the default rate and burst values for this operation. Selling partners whose business demands require higher throughput may see higher rate and burst values then those shown here. For more information, see [Usage Plans and Rate Limits in the Selling Partner API](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/usage-plans-and-rate-limits-in-the-sp-api).

response.name: Success.
